name: Gluten-Free Penne With Peas, Ricotta and Tarragon
description: The reason I choose penne for this dish is because I always like the way the peas find their way inside the little tubes. The dish is simple, sweet with tarragon, and very quickly made. You must serve it right away or the ricotta will stiffen.
keywords: fall, winter, gluten-free, halal, healthy, high fiber, kosher, low cholesterol, low sugar, nut-free, vegetarian, main course
recipeIngredient: 3/4 pound gluten-free penne, such as quinoa and rice
1 garlic clove, mashed with a pinch of salt in a mortar and pestle or put through a press

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt generously. Add pasta and peas. While pasta is cooking, mix together garlic, ricotta and tarragon in a large bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

When the pasta is cooked al dente, remove 1/4 cup of the pasta water and mix 2 to 4 tablespoons of it with the ricotta. It should have the consistency of cream. Add a little more water if it doesn’t. Drain pasta and peas and toss with ricotta mixture and Parmesan. Serve at once.
